column1: verif_1;1;A given date is no later than a second given date. ;intraform;"date1::ic_date::seronco1

column2: date2 = 'data_final'";It is assumed that date1 is the earlier date. This check is typically used for start and end date pairs
column3: but it also applies to any pair of dates where one is known to precede the other.

column1: verif_2;1;The period between the two given dates falls within a defined range.;interform;"date1::ic_date::seronco1

column5: unit = 'years';The period of time is defined from date1 to date2. Make sure date1 is the expected earlier date.

column1: verif_3;1;The variable's value matches the expected value.;intraform;"var_name::any
verif_4;1;A variable's value is constant across instances.;intraform_multiinstance;var_name::any;var_name = 'tm_n?tl_site_lesion_\\d+';This verification accepts pattern names.
verif_5;1;The overall RECIST response agrees with the reported responses of the target
verif_6;1;Last follow-up of an alive patient is within the expected schelude.;intraform_multiinstance;"last_fu_date::last_fu_date::brave

column2: last_fu_status = 'last_fu_status';Only applies to the last instance. If there are 0 survival instances
